blog.description: I DON'T CONDONE HATE OR BASHING OF ANY KIND SO PLEASE KEEP YOUR COMMENTS AND OPINIONS IN YOUR OWN TAGS. IF YOU ADD THEM TO MY POSTS YOU WILL BE BLOCKED. THANK YOU. Writer/Artist/Craftswoman/Admin for The Dalektables/ Huge Nerd and proud of it. David Tennant is my All-Time Favorite Actor and I'm really excited about Good Omens. Interests: Marvel/DC: tv/movies, Supernatural, Doctor Who, Doctor x Rose Shipper (Very anti-moffat.) I also LOVE Jodie and think Chris Chibnall's doing a great job. _______________________ My Fics on ao3................... My fics on FF.Net............... My YouTube Videos............ blog.description: Ania. 23. Poland. THIS BLOG IS CURRENTLY A MICHAEL SHEEN MESS. I’m sorry. Tennant is my hero, I ship DTxGT because they are adorable, The Doctor x Rose, Lucifer x Chloe, I love Alec Hardy with my whole heart and still am not okay that Hardy x Miller didn’t happen, I read too much fanfics and still have a soft spot for Downey Jr. Hello!

blog.name: fandom-imagines-stories
blog.title: Fandom Imagines
blog.description:
Just to let you know I no longer take requests and I don't do tag lists.
Current Obsession: My Marvel Boys- Tony Stark and Peter Parker, and once again: Aidan Turner "I still am a geek, I don't see anything wrong with it. I see no shame in having an unhealthy obsession with something." - David Tennant                    Disclaimer: I don't own anything I write for nor the images I use. All credit goes to owners.  My personal account is @erin-stilinski

summary: Did She Know?
title: Did She Know?
body:
Alec Hardy x Daughter Reader

Words: 2366

Part One, Part Two

Summary: Alec scrambles to locate where Joe has taken you before it’s too late. You try to negotiate with a killer.

Notes: This is the final part of this series, there may be more Alec x Daughter Reader stories, but I really hope you guys have enjoyed this. I love this show and I miss it!

Warnings: There is going to be a bit of gore in this one, so just be prepared.


You watched Joe pace around the room, twirling the knife around with one hand and holding the cell phone in the other. You felt your body shaking, every inch of you wishing that you could run as far away as possible. The ropes binding your hands dug into your wrists as you tried to wriggle them free. You stopped as soon as Joe’s eyes landed on you.

“You’re quite a pretty little thing, aren’t you?” He knelt down in front of you and ripped off the duct tape, causing you to wince. “Too bad you look like your old man.” He lifted your chin to look at him, forcing you to stand. “We’ll take care of that now, won’t we?” You held your breath as he raised the knife to your face, dragging the blade just above your left eyebrow. You resisted the urge to cry out as blood began to drip down into your eye, making it hard to see.

“My dad was right. You don’t have to do this. You can still get away before they find us.” You tried to reason with him. He chuckled and shook his head.

“Oh sweetheart,” his smile made you feel sick. “They won’t find us. Not until I’m finished with you. Now,” He lowered the knife down to your lips, “let’s see what we can do about that mouth of yours.” Just as he was about to make a cut, lights flashed by the window. He muttered to himself. “Shit.” He set down the knife and went to the windows. You saw the knife on the table and snatched it up, carefully taking it in your hands and slowly sawing away at your restraints. He turned around just as you broke free, throwing open the doors and running out into the grass.

You only got a few yards away before he tackled you to the ground as you screamed as loud as your lungs could muster. He grabbed you by the hair and slammed your head into the dirt, enough to make your vision blur and your ears ring.

“I know just what to do with you, you little bitch!” Joe screamed into your ear, dragging you back inside as you clawed at the ground.

Ellie stepped on the gas, the car zooming down the road. Alec was looking through files, trying to figure out what Joe meant.

“Of course.” He exclaimed, holding up a picture of the white cottage where Danny Latimer was killed. “Where it all started.” Ellie nodded and made a sharp turn around a corner.

“Hold on.” She warned, speeding up the car.

When they reached the cottage, there was a single light on inside. Without even waiting for Ellie to park, Alec was running up the hill, pulling out his gun and raising it as he burst inside. That’s when the screams started.

“Y/N!” He called out, but there was no answer. Only the screams. He searched every inch of the cottage, but Joe was nowhere to be found and neither was Y/N. It wasn’t until he checked the living room again that he realized where the screams were coming from. There was a tablet sitting on the table, playing a video on loop. Alec picked up the tablet and felt sick.

“Say hello, Y/N.” Joe sneered as he set up the tablet to film. You were in the background, pinned to the floor by Joe, who was kneeling above you. That’s when he dug the knife into your arm. Alec could tell you were trying to fight him, trying to keep from crying out, but as he dragged the blade, blood starting to drip down your arm. But as he dug deeper, you started to scream.

“Oh my god.” Ellie cried, looking at the video over Alec’s shoulder. Joe carved and you continued to scream. Alec couldn’t bear to watch but for some reason couldn’t tear his eyes away. It was like he was frozen and all that he could hear was his little girl’s pain. When he was finished, Joe picked up the tablet.

“I think I did pretty well, what about you Alec?” He sneered, focusing on the bloody letters carved in your arm. Payback. At this point, you had stopped screaming. You were hunched on the ground, crying into the sleeve of your school uniform. Joe grabbed a fistful of your hair and yanked you up so that you were sitting, your bruised and bloodied face facing the camera. “Say goodbye to daddy, Y/N.”

The video started to replay, but Ellie grabbed the tablet from Alec’s hands, stuffing it into an evidence bag as quickly as she could. Alec clenched his fists.

“That bastard.” He growled, but beneath his rage was a feeling of hopelessness. “He could be anywhere. What if-”

“Don’t you dare start talking like that.” Ellie snapped. “We are going to find her, Alec.” She placed an assuring hand on his shoulder and he let out a deep sigh.

“Did she know?” He wondered quietly.

“What?” Ellie looked down at him and saw a look of sadness in his eyes like she’d never seen in him before.

“Did Y/N know that I loved her?” His voice broke and a tear fell down his face. She’d never seen him cry before and it broke her heart. This strong man that she looked up to- not that she’d tell him that- was broken.

“Of course she knew. And we can’t give up yet.” Ellie racked her brain, thinking of all the possibilities of where they could have gone. She thought back to something she saw at the end of the video. Slowly, she grabbed the tablet again and played the last few seconds.

“Look there.” She pointed to a reflection in the window. Headlights. “He must have just taken this because that’s our car.” Realization washed over Alec. “And since we didn’t see anyone leaving, that means that-”

“They’re still here.” The two listened carefully to the silence around them. Then the sound of a door slamming and feet running had the detectives sprinting after them. Joe was dragging you behind him when you heard your father calling your name.

“Dad!” You yelled back into the night, two shadowing figures chasing after you. Joe pulled you forward, but you planted your feet. If you could just buy yourself enough time for them to catch up. It was the end of the line and Joe knew it. He yanked you to him, wrapping an arm around your stomach and placing the knife against your throat.

“This is it.” He snarled in your ear, backing up further to the edge of the cliff.

“Joe!” Alec shouted, catching up. He had a gun raised, but his eyes grew wide when he saw the blade at your neck. “Don’t do this Joe.”

“Don’t tell me what to fucking do.” He growled, stepping back again.. You heard the sea roll beneath you and held your breath.

“Dad,” You cried, reaching your hand out towards him. Joe tightened his hold on you, applying enough pressure on the knife to draw blood.

“Don’t come any closer!” He screamed at Alec. Ellie looked at the man she used to love.

“What have you become?” She asked, her voice filled with disgust.

“You did this to me.” He spat. “This town turned me into this.”

“You killed an eleven-year-old boy.” She said, taking a step forward. “You killed your son’s best friend.” Through all of this, your father kept his eyes on you.

“It’s going to be okay.” He assured you, trying not to look at the blood still dripping down your arm.

“I wouldn’t lie to the poor girl.” Joe laughed darkly. “She’s been through enough tonight.” Alec shifted his gaze, his eyes blazing as he raised his gun to Joe’s head.

“Let her go.” He ordered. “This can only end two ways for you, in the station or at the bottom of that cliff.”

“You think you’re so clever, don’t you?” He moved his arm from your stomach, giving you an opportunity to shove away from him. Everything happened so fast after that. As you tried to escape his grasp, he swung the knife at you. But before he could reach you, an ear-splitting sound rang through the air. Alec had fired into Joe’s left shoulder, causing him to stumble backward over the cliff. As his final act of revenge, his hand wrapped around your ankle dragging you down with him.

“Y/N!”Alec screamed, diving down as you clawed the grass, trying to grab onto something. But Joe’s weight pulled you down as he held onto your foot. You looked down at the man who had put you through so much pain, the man who had killed Danny Latimer. You used all your strength to kick your foot down into his face and felt his hold on you slip. You were able to barely latch onto the edge of the cliff as Joe fell, his body hitting the ground with an awful thud.

“Don’t look at him, sweetheart,” Ellie said, reaching out for you next to Alec. The rock beneath your hands started to crumble and you fell further towards the ground below.

“Take my hand!” Alec called over the roaring waves below. You hesitated. If you let go of the cliff, you would fall. Your father looked down at you, desperation in his eyes. “I need you to take my hand, darling.” The wind whipped at your hair, loose strands sticking to the tears that streamed down your cheeks. The rest of the cliff gave away and before you could fall, you grabbed your father’s hand.

Alec pulled you back up onto the cliff, making sure you were safe on stable ground before pulling you into his arms. You latched onto him, crying into his suit jacket. Ellie knelt down beside you, running a comforting hand up and down your arm, careful not to touch your bleeding wound, as your father cradled to back of your head.

“I thought I’d lost you.” Alec sighed into your hair. “I’m so sorry.”

“Don’t you go blaming yourself now.” You ordered, pushing away to look at him. “What matters is that you’re here and you found me. It’s alright. I’m alright.” Alec smiled at you and pulled you back into a hug, swearing to himself that he’d never let anything happen to you for as long as he lived.

“My brave girl.”

Three Weeks Later

You stared out at the horizon, feeling the peaceful breeze blow through your hair and listening to the waves hit the sand. You took a deep breath in. And a deep breath out. It had been your first day back at school. It hadn’t gone as bad as you expected. You were able to ignore the stares and whispers. But it was nice to have some peace and quiet.

“How’d it go today?” Beth wondered. Ever since the incident, you’d been meeting up with Beth Latimer twice a week, or whenever you needed it.

“Alright.” You shrugged and quietly added. “I was worried about dad.” Beth chuckled.

“Does he still have you on a leash?” She joked. Alec was the one who’d asked her to speak with you in the first place. She was glad that he did.

“He barely lets me leave the house.” You exclaimed and the two of you laughed. “He’s getting better, though. And I know why he does it, but sometimes I just need to be alone.” You turned your head to the cliffs and closed your eyes.

“Are you still having the dreams?” Beth asked gently. You sighed and nodded.

“They’re getting less frequent, but it’s still hard to sleep.” Almost every night you’d woken up screaming with Alec rushing into your room to comfort you. But you were getting better.

“The nightmares might never stop.” Beth put a hand on your shoulder. “But you are a strong, beautiful girl. You’ll learn how to fight them. You’ve already come so far. I’m so proud of you.” She gave you a smile and pulled you in for a hug. Your phone buzzed with a text. You shook your head and grinned.

“I’ve got to go. Dad’s buying us ice cream.” You waved goodbye as you walked towards your dad’s car.

“How’d it go?” He asked as you got in. You shot him a look.

“You know you’re not supposed to ask about it.”

“I’m not asking about it!” He defended. “I just want to know how you’re doing.” You rolled your eyes and gave him a peck on the cheek.

“It was nice.” You buckled the seatbelt as he started down the road. “I’m glad you’ve been having me see Beth. She’s really great.”

“That’s good.” He nodded. He took a deep breath. “Do you mind if Miller comes with us? She’s been asking about you.” You smirked.

“As long as you two don’t start bickering about who pays again.”

“We don’t bicker. We… debate.”

“Whatever you say, dad.” You snickered. As the two of you got out of the car, Ellie joined you from hers. It was getting warm out so you took of the jacket you were wearing but paused, looking down at your exposed arm. The marks were still an angry red and they’d started to scar. You remembered everything Beth had told you about fighting it and not letting him get in your head. About turning the word against him. Make your survival and triumphs your own payback against him and his failure to destroy you.

“Are you alright?” Alec asked, his brows knitted together with worry. You looked up at him and smiled.

“I think for the first time in three weeks I can honestly say that I am.” He gave you his usual awkward smile and put an arm around you in a kind of side hug. You laughed to yourself at his awkwardness but loved it all the same. The three of you walked up to the booth, Ellie and you teasing your dad about his tense nature and of course, they still argued about who would pay. And you felt safe.

Ellie knelt down beside you, running a comforting hand up and down your arm, careful not to touch your bleeding wound, as your father cradled to back of your head.

“I thought I’d lost you.” Alec sighed into your hair. “I’m so sorry.”

“Don’t you go blaming yourself now.” You ordered, pushing away to look at him. “What matters is that you’re here and you found me. It’s alright. I’m alright.” Alec smiled at you and pulled you back into a hug, swearing to himself that he’d never let anything happen to you for as long as he lived.

“My brave girl.”

Three Weeks Later

You stared out at the horizon, feeling the peaceful breeze blow through your hair and listening to the waves hit the sand. You took a deep breath in. And a deep breath out. It had been your first day back at school. It hadn’t gone as bad as you expected. You were able to ignore the stares and whispers. But it was nice to have some peace and quiet.

“How’d it go today?” Beth wondered. Ever since the incident, you’d been meeting up with Beth Latimer twice a week, or whenever you needed it.

“Alright.” You shrugged and quietly added. “I was worried about dad.” Beth chuckled.

“Does he still have you on a leash?” She joked. Alec was the one who’d asked her to speak with you in the first place. She was glad that he did.

“He barely lets me leave the house.” You exclaimed and the two of you laughed. “He’s getting better, though. And I know why he does it, but sometimes I just need to be alone.” You turned your head to the cliffs and closed your eyes.

“Are you still having the dreams?” Beth asked gently. You sighed and nodded.

“They’re getting less frequent, but it’s still hard to sleep.” Almost every night you’d woken up screaming with Alec rushing into your room to comfort you. But you were getting better.

“The nightmares might never stop.” Beth put a hand on your shoulder. “But you are a strong, beautiful girl. You’ll learn how to fight them. You’ve already come so far. I’m so proud of you.” She gave you a smile and pulled you in for a hug. Your phone buzzed with a text. You shook your head and grinned.

“I’ve got to go. Dad’s buying us ice cream.” You waved goodbye as you walked towards your dad’s car.

“How’d it go?” He asked as you got in. You shot him a look.

“You know you’re not supposed to ask about it.”

“I’m not asking about it!” He defended. “I just want to know how you’re doing.” You rolled your eyes and gave him a peck on the cheek.

“It was nice.” You buckled the seatbelt as he started down the road. “I’m glad you’ve been having me see Beth. She’s really great.”

“That’s good.” He nodded. He took a deep breath. “Do you mind if Miller comes with us? She’s been asking about you.” You smirked.

“As long as you two don’t start bickering about who pays again.”

“We don’t bicker. We… debate.”

“Whatever you say, dad.” You snickered. As the two of you got out of the car, Ellie joined you from hers. It was getting warm out so you took of the jacket you were wearing but paused, looking down at your exposed arm. The marks were still an angry red and they’d started to scar. You remembered everything Beth had told you about fighting it and not letting him get in your head. About turning the word against him. Make your survival and triumphs your own payback against him and his failure to destroy you.

“Are you alright?” Alec asked, his brows knitted together with worry. You looked up at him and smiled.

“I think for the first time in three weeks I can honestly say that I am.” He gave you his usual awkward smile and put an arm around you in a kind of side hug. You laughed to yourself at his awkwardness but loved it all the same. The three of you walked up to the booth, Ellie and you teasing your dad about his tense nature and of course, they still argued about who would pay. And you felt safe.

trail.content_raw:
Alec Hardy x Daughter Reader

Words: 2366

Part One, Part Two

Summary: Alec scrambles to locate where Joe has taken you before it’s too late. You try to negotiate with a killer.

Notes: This is the final part of this series, there may be more Alec x Daughter Reader stories, but I really hope you guys have enjoyed this. I love this show and I miss it!

Warnings: There is going to be a bit of gore in this one, so just be prepared.


You watched Joe pace around the room, twirling the knife around with one hand and holding the cell phone in the other. You felt your body shaking, every inch of you wishing that you could run as far away as possible. The ropes binding your hands dug into your wrists as you tried to wriggle them free. You stopped as soon as Joe’s eyes landed on you.

“You’re quite a pretty little thing, aren’t you?” He knelt down in front of you and ripped off the duct tape, causing you to wince. “Too bad you look like your old man.” He lifted your chin to look at him, forcing you to stand. “We’ll take care of that now, won’t we?” You held your breath as he raised the knife to your face, dragging the blade just above your left eyebrow. You resisted the urge to cry out as blood began to drip down into your eye, making it hard to see.

“My dad was right. You don’t have to do this. You can still get away before they find us.” You tried to reason with him. He chuckled and shook his head.

“Oh sweetheart,” his smile made you feel sick. “They won’t find us. Not until I’m finished with you. Now,” He lowered the knife down to your lips, “let’s see what we can do about that mouth of yours.” Just as he was about to make a cut, lights flashed by the window. He muttered to himself. “Shit.” He set down the knife and went to the windows. You saw the knife on the table and snatched it up, carefully taking it in your hands and slowly sawing away at your restraints. He turned around just as you broke free, throwing open the doors and running out into the grass.

You only got a few yards away before he tackled you to the ground as you screamed as loud as your lungs could muster. He grabbed you by the hair and slammed your head into the dirt, enough to make your vision blur and your ears ring.

“I know just what to do with you, you little bitch!” Joe screamed into your ear, dragging you back inside as you clawed at the ground.

Ellie stepped on the gas, the car zooming down the road. Alec was looking through files, trying to figure out what Joe meant.

“Of course.” He exclaimed, holding up a picture of the white cottage where Danny Latimer was killed. “Where it all started.” Ellie nodded and made a sharp turn around a corner.

“Hold on.” She warned, speeding up the car.

When they reached the cottage, there was a single light on inside. Without even waiting for Ellie to park, Alec was running up the hill, pulling out his gun and raising it as he burst inside. That’s when the screams started.

[[MORE]]

“Y/N!” He called out, but there was no answer. Only the screams. He searched every inch of the cottage, but Joe was nowhere to be found and neither was Y/N. It wasn’t until he checked the living room again that he realized where the screams were coming from. There was a tablet sitting on the table, playing a video on loop. Alec picked up the tablet and felt sick.

“Say hello, Y/N.” Joe sneered as he set up the tablet to film. You were in the background, pinned to the floor by Joe, who was kneeling above you. That’s when he dug the knife into your arm. Alec could tell you were trying to fight him, trying to keep from crying out, but as he dragged the blade, blood starting to drip down your arm. But as he dug deeper, you started to scream.

“Oh my god.” Ellie cried, looking at the video over Alec’s shoulder. Joe carved and you continued to scream. Alec couldn’t bear to watch but for some reason couldn’t tear his eyes away. It was like he was frozen and all that he could hear was his little girl’s pain. When he was finished, Joe picked up the tablet.

“I think I did pretty well, what about you Alec?” He sneered, focusing on the bloody letters carved in your arm. Payback. At this point, you had stopped screaming. You were hunched on the ground, crying into the sleeve of your school uniform. Joe grabbed a fistful of your hair and yanked you up so that you were sitting, your bruised and bloodied face facing the camera. “Say goodbye to daddy, Y/N.”

The video started to replay, but Ellie grabbed the tablet from Alec’s hands, stuffing it into an evidence bag as quickly as she could. Alec clenched his fists.

“That bastard.” He growled, but beneath his rage was a feeling of hopelessness. “He could be anywhere. What if-”

“Don’t you dare start talking like that.” Ellie snapped. “We are going to find her, Alec.” She placed an assuring hand on his shoulder and he let out a deep sigh.

“Did she know?” He wondered quietly.

“What?” Ellie looked down at him and saw a look of sadness in his eyes like she’d never seen in him before.

“Did Y/N know that I loved her?” His voice broke and a tear fell down his face. She’d never seen him cry before and it broke her heart. This strong man that she looked up to- not that she’d tell him that- was broken.

“Of course she knew. And we can’t give up yet.” Ellie racked her brain, thinking of all the possibilities of where they could have gone. She thought back to something she saw at the end of the video. Slowly, she grabbed the tablet again and played the last few seconds.

“Look there.” She pointed to a reflection in the window. Headlights. “He must have just taken this because that’s our car.” Realization washed over Alec. “And since we didn’t see anyone leaving, that means that-”

“They’re still here.” The two listened carefully to the silence around them. Then the sound of a door slamming and feet running had the detectives sprinting after them. Joe was dragging you behind him when you heard your father calling your name.

“Dad!” You yelled back into the night, two shadowing figures chasing after you. Joe pulled you forward, but you planted your feet. If you could just buy yourself enough time for them to catch up. It was the end of the line and Joe knew it. He yanked you to him, wrapping an arm around your stomach and placing the knife against your throat.

“This is it.” He snarled in your ear, backing up further to the edge of the cliff.

“Joe!” Alec shouted, catching up. He had a gun raised, but his eyes grew wide when he saw the blade at your neck. “Don’t do this Joe.”

“Don’t tell me what to fucking do.” He growled, stepping back again.. You heard the sea roll beneath you and held your breath.

“Dad,” You cried, reaching your hand out towards him. Joe tightened his hold on you, applying enough pressure on the knife to draw blood.

“Don’t come any closer!” He screamed at Alec. Ellie looked at the man she used to love.

“What have you become?” She asked, her voice filled with disgust.

“You did this to me.” He spat. “This town turned me into this.”

“You killed an eleven-year-old boy.” She said, taking a step forward. “You killed your son’s best friend.” Through all of this, your father kept his eyes on you.

“It’s going to be okay.” He assured you, trying not to look at the blood still dripping down your arm.

“I wouldn’t lie to the poor girl.” Joe laughed darkly. “She’s been through enough tonight.” Alec shifted his gaze, his eyes blazing as he raised his gun to Joe’s head.

“Let her go.” He ordered. “This can only end two ways for you, in the station or at the bottom of that cliff.”

“You think you’re so clever, don’t you?” He moved his arm from your stomach, giving you an opportunity to shove away from him. Everything happened so fast after that. As you tried to escape his grasp, he swung the knife at you. But before he could reach you, an ear-splitting sound rang through the air. Alec had fired into Joe’s left shoulder, causing him to stumble backward over the cliff. As his final act of revenge, his hand wrapped around your ankle dragging you down with him.

“Y/N!”Alec screamed, diving down as you clawed the grass, trying to grab onto something. But Joe’s weight pulled you down as he held onto your foot. You looked down at the man who had put you through so much pain, the man who had killed Danny Latimer. You used all your strength to kick your foot down into his face and felt his hold on you slip. You were able to barely latch onto the edge of the cliff as Joe fell, his body hitting the ground with an awful thud.

“Don’t look at him, sweetheart,” Ellie said, reaching out for you next to Alec. The rock beneath your hands started to crumble and you fell further towards the ground below.

“Take my hand!” Alec called over the roaring waves below. You hesitated. If you let go of the cliff, you would fall. Your father looked down at you, desperation in his eyes. “I need you to take my hand, darling.” The wind whipped at your hair, loose strands sticking to the tears that streamed down your cheeks. The rest of the cliff gave away and before you could fall, you grabbed your father’s hand.

Alec pulled you back up onto the cliff, making sure you were safe on stable ground before pulling you into his arms. You latched onto him, crying into his suit jacket. Ellie knelt down beside you, running a comforting hand up and down your arm, careful not to touch your bleeding wound, as your father cradled to back of your head.

“I thought I’d lost you.” Alec sighed into your hair. “I’m so sorry.”

“Don’t you go blaming yourself now.” You ordered, pushing away to look at him. “What matters is that you’re here and you found me. It’s alright. I’m alright.” Alec smiled at you and pulled you back into a hug, swearing to himself that he’d never let anything happen to you for as long as he lived.

“My brave girl.”

Three Weeks Later

You stared out at the horizon, feeling the peaceful breeze blow through your hair and listening to the waves hit the sand. You took a deep breath in. And a deep breath out. It had been your first day back at school. It hadn’t gone as bad as you expected. You were able to ignore the stares and whispers. But it was nice to have some peace and quiet.

“How’d it go today?” Beth wondered. Ever since the incident, you’d been meeting up with Beth Latimer twice a week, or whenever you needed it.

“Alright.” You shrugged and quietly added. “I was worried about dad.” Beth chuckled.

“Does he still have you on a leash?” She joked. Alec was the one who’d asked her to speak with you in the first place. She was glad that he did.

“He barely lets me leave the house.” You exclaimed and the two of you laughed. “He’s getting better, though. And I know why he does it, but sometimes I just need to be alone.” You turned your head to the cliffs and closed your eyes.

“Are you still having the dreams?” Beth asked gently. You sighed and nodded.

“They’re getting less frequent, but it’s still hard to sleep.” Almost every night you’d woken up screaming with Alec rushing into your room to comfort you. But you were getting better.

“The nightmares might never stop.” Beth put a hand on your shoulder. “But you are a strong, beautiful girl. You’ll learn how to fight them. You’ve already come so far. I’m so proud of you.” She gave you a smile and pulled you in for a hug. Your phone buzzed with a text. You shook your head and grinned.

“I’ve got to go. Dad’s buying us ice cream.” You waved goodbye as you walked towards your dad’s car.

“How’d it go?” He asked as you got in. You shot him a look.

“You know you’re not supposed to ask about it.”

“I’m not asking about it!” He defended. “I just want to know how you’re doing.” You rolled your eyes and gave him a peck on the cheek.

“It was nice.” You buckled the seatbelt as he started down the road. “I’m glad you’ve been having me see Beth. She’s really great.”

“That’s good.” He nodded. He took a deep breath. “Do you mind if Miller comes with us? She’s been asking about you.” You smirked.

“As long as you two don’t start bickering about who pays again.”

“We don’t bicker. We… debate.”

“Whatever you say, dad.” You snickered. As the two of you got out of the car, Ellie joined you from hers. It was getting warm out so you took of the jacket you were wearing but paused, looking down at your exposed arm. The marks were still an angry red and they’d started to scar. You remembered everything Beth had told you about fighting it and not letting him get in your head. About turning the word against him. Make your survival and triumphs your own payback against him and his failure to destroy you.

“Are you alright?” Alec asked, his brows knitted together with worry. You looked up at him and smiled.

“I think for the first time in three weeks I can honestly say that I am.” He gave you his usual awkward smile and put an arm around you in a kind of side hug. You laughed to yourself at his awkwardness but loved it all the same. The three of you walked up to the booth, Ellie and you teasing your dad about his tense nature and of course, they still argued about who would pay. And you felt safe.

You resisted the urge to cry out as blood began to drip down into your eye, making it hard to see.

“My dad was right. You don’t have to do this. You can still get away before they find us.” You tried to reason with him. He chuckled and shook his head.

“Oh sweetheart,” his smile made you feel sick. “They won’t find us. Not until I’m finished with you. Now,” He lowered the knife down to your lips, “let’s see what we can do about that mouth of yours.” Just as he was about to make a cut, lights flashed by the window. He muttered to himself. “Shit.” He set down the knife and went to the windows. You saw the knife on the table and snatched it up, carefully taking it in your hands and slowly sawing away at your restraints. He turned around just as you broke free, throwing open the doors and running out into the grass.

You only got a few yards away before he tackled you to the ground as you screamed as loud as your lungs could muster. He grabbed you by the hair and slammed your head into the dirt, enough to make your vision blur and your ears ring.

“I know just what to do with you, you little bitch!” Joe screamed into your ear, dragging you back inside as you clawed at the ground.

Ellie stepped on the gas, the car zooming down the road. Alec was looking through files, trying to figure out what Joe meant.

“Of course.” He exclaimed, holding up a picture of the white cottage where Danny Latimer was killed. “Where it all started.” Ellie nodded and made a sharp turn around a corner.

“Hold on.” She warned, speeding up the car.

When they reached the cottage, there was a single light on inside. Without even waiting for Ellie to park, Alec was running up the hill, pulling out his gun and raising it as he burst inside. That’s when the screams started.

summary: So about a month ago I had this dream.  It all started out with Brendon Urie wearing these tacky obviously homemade felt like...
body:
So about a month ago I had this dream. 

It all started out with Brendon Urie wearing these tacky obviously homemade felt like costumes you see from high school, maybe even middle school plays. He was wearing this awful green hat and performing this play that I honestly have no idea what it was about, but I’m assuming it was written by one of the students.

He was playing all the parts by himself. Changing his voice and running from side to side to show he has changed character. There was a shift to the audience where out of all the seats there was a single person there watching, David Tennant.

It zoomed out to show what he must have looked like from Brendon’s POV, at least 15 rows back. Then you hear David yell, “YOU’RE A CLAM DADDY”

I’m not sure what it meant, but Brendon did and he was definitely insulted.
